page.title: 01BARNBY in the WILLOWS(Notts)
page.content: Barnby is a village which has escaped the interference of motorways and trunk roads and remains a cul de sac backed on two sides by the River Witham which more or less forms the boundary between Nottinghamshire and Lincolnshire at this point. The village is no longer surrounded by meadows and willow trees, modern dredging of the dykes and river has cleared away the willow trees and the meadows have been ploughed for cereal production. The A1,A17,& A46 are reasonably near as is the main London to Edinburgh railway line, the nearest station being in Newark some five miles away. There is mains water, mains electricity, a good sewage system and street lighting, all relatively new, having been installed quite within living memory.
